Description: Producers of agricultural products. Includes crop growers, owners of plantations and companies that produce and process foods but do not package and market them. Excludes companies classified in the forest products sub-industry and those that package and market the food products classified in the packaged foods sub-industry.

Companies providing air freight transportation, courier and logistics services, including package and mail delivery and customs agents. Excludes those companies classified in the airlines, marine or trucking sub-industries.

Manufacturers of apparel, accessories & luxury goods. Includes companies primarily producing designer handbags, wallets, luggage, jewellery and watches. Excludes shoes classified in the footwear sub-industry.
Retailers specialised mainly in apparel and accessories.

Companies that produce mainly passenger automobiles and light trucks. Excludes companies producing mainly motorcycles and three-wheelers classified in the motorcycle manufacturers sub-industry and heavy duty trucks classified in the construction & farm machinery & heavy trucks sub-industry.
Manufacturers of parts and accessories for  automobiles and motorcycles. Excludes companies classified in the tyres & rubber sub-industry.

Owners and operators of stores specialising in automotive retail.  Includes auto dealers, gas stations, and retailers of auto accessories, motorcycles & parts, automotive glass, and automotive equipment & parts.
Distributors of alcoholic and non-alcoholic products to other companies and not directly to the consumer.
Producers of beer and malt liquors. Includes breweries not classified in the restaurants sub-industry.
Mail order and TV home shopping retailers. Includes companies that provide door-to-door retail.
Owners and operators of consumer electronics, computers, video and related products retail stores.

Manufacturers of consumer electronics products including TVs, VCRs, hi-fi equipment, game consoles and related products. Excludes personal home computer manufacturers classified in the computer hardware sub-industry, and electric household appliances classified in the household appliances sub-industry.

Owners and operators of retail stores  that typically sell a limited line of high-convenience items and food basics, such as milk, bread, beverages, and snacks. Some also offer ready-made sandwiches and other prepared foods for immediate consumption along with an assortment of non-food items, such as magazines. Many sell gasoline, operator car washes and provide other automotive-related products.
Owners and operators of department stores.
Distributors and wholesalers of general merchandise not classified elsewhere. Includes vehicle distributors.
Distributors of food products to other companies and not directly to the consumer.
Owners and operators of primarily drug retail stores and pharmacies.
Manufacturers of footwear. Includes sport and leather shoes.
Owners and operators of stores offering diversified general merchandise. Excludes hypermarkets and large-scale super centres classified in the hypermarkets & super centres sub-industry.

Owners and operators of furniture and home furnishings retail stores.  Includes residential furniture, home furnishings, housewares, and interior design.  Excludes home and garden improvement stores, classified in the home improvement retail sub-industry.
Manufacturers of soft home furnishings or furniture, including upholstery, carpets and wall-coverings.
Owners and operators of home and garden improvement retail stores. Includes stores offering building materials and supplies.

Manufacturers of electric household appliances and related products.  Includes manufacturers of power and hand tools, including garden improvement tools.  Excludes TVs and other audio and video products classified in the consumer electronics sub-industry and personal computers classified in the computer hardware sub-industry.
Producers of non-durable household products, including detergents, soaps, diapers and other tissue and household paper products not classified in the paper products sub-industry.
Manufacturers of durable household products, including cutlery, cookware, glassware, crystal, silverware, utensils, kitchenware and consumer specialties not classified elsewhere.
Companies providing retail services primarily on the internet, not classified elsewhere.
Manufacturers of leisure products and equipment including sports equipment, bicycles and toys.
Companies that produce motorcycles, scooters or three-wheelers. Excludes bicycles classified in the leisure products sub-industry.
Producers of packaged foods including dairy products, fruit juices, meats, poultry, fish and pet foods.
Manufacturers of personal and beauty care products, including cosmetics and perfumes.
Manufacturers of photographic equipment and related products.
Owners and operators of specialty retail stores not classified elsewhere. Includes jewellery stores, toy stores, office supply stores, health & vision care stores, and book & entertainment stores.
Manufacturers of textile and related products not classified in the apparel, accessories & luxury goods, footwear or home furnishings sub-industries.
Manufacturers of cigarettes and other tobacco products.
Companies providing primarily goods land transportation.
Manufacturers of tyres and rubber.

Includes producers of solar power and wind power, used to generate electricity, as well as power producers from the use of hydro, wave and tidal power. Also includes companies that generate electricity or power through alternative energy sources such as biogas, biomass, biofuels, clean energy, geothermal, waste, water and waves. Also includes nuclear.

Companies primarily involved in the production of coal  related products and other consumable fuels related to the generation of energy.  Excludes companies primarily producing gases classified in the industrial gases sub-industry and companies primarily mining for metallurgical (coking) coal used for steel production.
Companies that produce, transmit or distribute electricity, using various types of power facilities (e.g. hydro, coal, gas and nuclear).
Includes companies involved in energy transmission and distribution, including  pipes, wires, storage, grid etc., as well as energy storage companies.

Companies providing environmental and facilities maintenance services.   Includes energy from waste, waste management, facilities management and pollution control services.  Excludes large-scale water treatment systems classified in the water utilities sub-industry.

Manufacturers of equipment, including drilling rigs, pipes and equipment, and providers of supplies, transportation and services to companies involved in the exploration and production of mines and the drilling, evaluation and completion of oil and gas wells.

Companies involved in the transmission or distribution of natural and manufactured gas. Excludes companies primarily involved in gas exploration or production classified in the oil & gas exploration & production sub-industry.   Also excludes diversified midstream natural gas companies classified in the oil & gas storage & transportation sub-industry.

Sub level: Independent power producers and energy traders
Description: Companies that operate as independent power producers (IPPs), gas & power marketing & trading specialists or Integrated energy merchants.   Excludes electric transmission companies and utility distribution companies classified in the electric utilities sub-industry.
No description
No description
No description
Utility companies with significantly diversified activities in addition to core electric utility, gas utility or water utility operations.
Integrated oil companies engaged in the exploration & production of oil and gas, as well as at least one other significant activity in either refining, marketing and transportation, or chemicals.
No description
No description
No description
Companies that purchase and redistribute water to the end-consumer. Includes large-scale water treatment systems.

Financial institutions and government sponsored entities primarily engaged in investment management. Includes companies operating mutual funds, hedge funds, closed-end funds, unit investment trusts and special purpose vehicles.
Financial institutions primarily that facilitates the buying and selling of financial derivatives between a buyer and a seller and provide a source of up-to-date stock prices and quotes.
Diversified capital markets

Commercial banks whose businesses are derived primarily from commercial lending operations and have significant business activity in retail banking and small and medium corporate lending.  Excludes banks classified in the regional banks and thrifts & mortgage finance sub-industries. Also excludes investment banks classified in the investment banking & brokerage sub-industry.
No description

A cooperative financial institution that is owned and controlled by its members and operated for the purpose of promoting thrift, providing credit at competitive rates, and providing other financial services to its members
Other diversified financial services and multi-sector holdings

Financial institutions primarily engaged in providing administration and valuation fee-based services to mutual funds, hedge funds, closed-end funds, unit investment trusts and special purpose vehicles.

Private equity businesses investing or providing funding, generally of $100m to $1bn for leveraged buy outs, privatisation of large public companies and significant investments into large listed and unlisted companies
Primarily unregulated funds and special purpose vehicles open to a limited number of investors, requiring large initial investment, undertaking a wide variety of investments
Insurance and reinsurance brokerage firms.

Financial institutions primarily engaged in investment banking, including equity and debt underwriting, mergers and acquisitions, securities lending and advisory services. Excludes banks and other financial institutions primarily involved in commercial lending, asset management and specialised financial activities.
Companies providing primarily life, disability, indemnity or supplemental health insurance. Excludes managed care companies classified in the managed healthcare sub-industry.

Private equity businesses investing or providing funding, generally of $10m to $100m, be it equity, mezzanine or growth capital, into businesses requiring investment for a series of potential reasons: management buyout or ins, development capital to support organic or acquisitive growth, private placing or turnaround funding
No description
Providers of specialised financial services. Includes credit agencies, stock exchanges, specialty boutiques and providers of mezzanine finance

Financial institutions providing mortgage and mortgage related services.  These include financial institutions whose assets are primarily mortgage related, savings & loans,  mortgage lending institutions, building societies and companies providing insurance to mortgage banks.

Venture capital firms and venture capital trusts providing growth investment or funding for SMEs or start-ups which require equity funding of up to $10m for management buy outs/ins or development capital

Companies primarily engaged in the research, development, manufacturing or marketing of products based on genetic analysis and genetic engineering.  Includes companies specialising in protein-based therapeutics to treat human diseases
Health care distributors
Health care equipment and supplies

Providers of patient healthcare services not classified elsewhere. Includes dialysis centres, lab testing services, and pharmacy management services. Also includes companies providing business support services to health care providers, such as clerical support services, collection agency services, staffing services and outsourced sales & marketing services

Companies providing information technology services primarily to health care providers.  Includes companies providing application, systems or data processing software, internet-based tools, and IT consulting services to doctors, hospitals or businesses operating primarily in the healthcare sector.

Sub level: Hospitals, health systems, clinics and specialty provider services
Description: Healthcare facilities: Owners and operators of health care facilities, including hospitals, nursing homes or aged care, rehabilitation centres and animal hospitals.

Companies enabling the drug discovery, development and production continuum by providing analytical tools, instruments, consumables & supplies, clinical trial services and contract research services.  Includes firms primarily servicing the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries.

Sub level: Long term care, senior living organisations, continuing care retirement communities
Description: No description
Owners and operators of health maintenance organisations (HMOs) and other managed plans.
Companies engaged in the research, development or production of pharmaceuticals. Includes veterinary drugs.
Owners and operators of health care facilities, including hospitals, nursing homes, rehabilitation centres and animal hospitals.
Manufacturers of civil or military aerospace and defence equipment, parts or products. Includes defence electronics and space equipment.

Manufacturers of building components and home improvement products and equipment. Excludes lumber and plywood classified under Forest products and cement and other materials classified in the construction materials.

Companies that primarily produce industrial chemicals and basic chemicals. Including but not limited to plastics, synthetic fibres, films, commodity-based paints & pigments, explosives and petrochemicals. Excludes chemical companies classified in the diversified chemicals, fertilisers & agricultural chemicals, industrial gases, or specialty chemicals sub-industries.
Companies providing commercial printing services. Includes printers primarily serving the media industry.
Manufacturers of heavy duty trucks, rolling machinery, earth-moving and construction equipment, heavy farm machinery and manufacturers of related parts. Includes non-military shipbuilding.

Manufacturers of construction materials including sand, clay, gypsum, lime, aggregates, cement, concrete and bricks. Other finished or semi-finished building materials are classified  in the building products sub-industry.
Manufacturers of metal, glass or plastic containers. Includes corks and caps.
Companies that produce electric cables and wires, electrical components or equipment not classified in the heavy electrical equipment sub-industry.
Owners and operators of roads, tunnels and rail tracks.

Diversified industrial companies with business activities in three or more sectors, none of which contributes a majority of revenues. Stakes held are predominantly of a controlling nature and stake holders maintain an operational interest in the running of the subsidiaries.

Manufacturers of industrial machinery and industrial components. Includes companies that manufacture presses, machine tools, compressors, pollution control equipment, elevators, escalators, insulators, pumps, roller bearings and other metal fabrications.
Companies providing goods (including oil and gas shipping companies) or passenger maritime transportation. Excludes cruise-ships classified in the hotels, resorts & cruise lines sub-industry.
Owners and operators of marine ports and related services.
Manufacturers of office electronic equipment including copiers and faxes.
Providers of office services and manufacturers of office supplies and equipment not classified elsewhere.
Manufacturers of timber and related wood products. Includes lumber for the building industry.

Companies providing security and protection services to business and governments. Includes companies providing services such as correctional facilities, security & alarm services, armoured transportation & guarding.  Excludes companies providing security software classified under the systems software sub-industry and home security services classified under the Specialised consumer services sub-industry. Also excludes companies manufacturing security system equipment classified under the electronic equipment & instruments sub-industry.
Trading companies and other distributors of industrial equipment and products.
No description

Excludes companies providing employee education programs classified in the human resources & employment services sub-industry

An individual or a family
A trust or a fund set up to manage or invest in assets on behalf of an individual or a family
Local government is the lowest tier of administration within a state.
Development aid organisations dedicated to distributing aid, including bilateral, multilateral and international organisations, regional development banks, international finance institution (IFI).

A central or federal government is the government of a nation-state and is more typically a characteristic of a unitary state and may have distinct powers at various levels authorised or delegated to it by its member states.
A country subdivision in a federal form of government, sharing political power with the federal or national government.

A supranational union with negotiated power delegated to an authority by governments of member states. This includes organisations such as Africa Union (AU), European Union,  Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), Union of South American Nations (USAN), Arab League, North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA)

An entity treated by national laws and regulations to be under the guidance of the government but separate and autonomous from the government. The entity may receive revenue from charging customers for its services, but is partially or majorly funded by a government to deliver a specified service.
Companies engaged in primarily non-residential construction. Includes civil engineering companies and large-scale contractors. Excludes companies classified in the homebuilding sub-industry.
Residential construction companies. Includes manufacturers of prefabricated houses and semi-fixed manufactured homes.
Companies engaged in a diverse spectrum of real estate activities including real estate development & sales, real estate management, or real estate services, but with no dominant business line.
Companies engaged in providing energy efficient solutions for buildings
Companies that develop real estate and sell the properties after development. Excludes companies classified in the homebuilding sub-industry.
Companies engaged in operating real estate properties for the purpose of leasing & management.
A company or trust with significantly diversified operations across two or more property types.
Companies providing advertising, marketing or public relations services.

Companies primarily providing labour oriented support services to businesses and governments.  Includes commercial cleaning services, dining & catering services, equipment repair services, industrial maintenance services, industrial auctioneers, storage & warehousing, transaction services, uniform rental services, and other business support services.
No description
Including companies providing corporate head office management services and management advice and related consulting services

Companies providing business support services relating to human capital management. Includes employment agencies, employee training, payroll & benefit support services, retirement support services and temporary agencies.
Market Research and Statistical Services, scientific research services

Companies providing consumer services not classified elsewhere.  Includes residential services, home security, legal services, personal services, renovation & interior design services, consumer auctions and wedding & funeral services.

Publishing: publishers of newspapers, magazines and books, and providers of information in print or electronic formats.

Providers of communications and high-density data transmission services primarily through a high bandwidth or fibre-optic cable network.

Companies developing and marketing internet software or providing internet services including online databases and interactive services, web address registration services, database construction and internet design services. Excludes companies classified in the internet retail sub-industry.
